intro: Galium poiretianum, commonly known as Poiret's bedstraw, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and opposite, oval-shaped leaves that are often hairy. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers in clusters, typically blooming from June to August. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Galium poiretianum is native to Europe and is often found in temperate regions.
